text.0: allied with thee in friendship indra these thy priests remembering holy law rent vṛtra limb from limb.
text.1: when they bestowed the dawns and let the waters flow and when thou didst chastise dragons at kutsas call.
text.2: thou sentest forth productive powers clavest the hills thou dravest forth the kine thou drankest pleasant meath.
text.3: thou gavest increase through this trees surpassing might the sun shone by the hymn that sprang from holy law.
text.4: in the midway of heaven the sun unyoked his car the Ārya found a match to meet his dam foe.
text.5: associate with Ṛjiśvan indra overthrew the solid forts of pipru conjuring asura.
text.6: he boldly cast down forts which none had eer assailed unwearied he destroycd the godless treasurestores.
text.7: like sun and moon he took the strongholds wealth away and praised in song demolished foes with flashing dart.
text.8: armed with resistless weapons with vast power to cleave the vṛtraslayer whets his darts and deals fordi wounds.
text.9: bright uṣas was afraid of indras slaughtering bolt she went upon her way and left her chariot there.
text.10: these are thy famous exploits only thine when thou alone hast left the other reft of sacrifice.
text.11: thou in the heavens hast set the ordering of the moons the father bears the felly portioned out by thee.
